title: Analysis of accum. func. with graph of integrand

content.question: Let f be the function given by f(x) = (ln x)(sin x). The figure above shows the graph of f for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIYaGaeqiWdahaaa@3CDF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. The function g is defined by g(x) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WGMbGaaiikaiaadshacaGGPaGaamizaiaadshaaSqaaiaaigdaaeaa caWG4baaniabgUIiYdaaaa@3EF6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIYaGaeqiWdahaaa@3CDF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find g(1) and g'(1).

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by f(x) = (ln x)(sin x). The figure above shows the graph of f for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIYaGaeqiWdahaaa@3CDF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. The function g is defined by g(x) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WGMbGaaiikaiaadshacaGGPaGaamizaiaadshaaSqaaiaaigdaaeaa caWG4baaniabgUIiYdaaaa@3EF6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIYaGaeqiWdahaaa@3CDF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find g(1) and g'(1).
(b) On what intervals, if any, is g increasing? Justify your answer.

(c) For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CDD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, find the value of x at which g has an absolute minimum. Justify your answer.
(d) For 0 < x < 2π, is there a value of x at which the graph of g is tangent to the x-axis? Explain why or why not.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
